alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:46PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT AREAS NEAR I-17 FROM LOCATIONS SOUTH OF MUNDS PARK TO CAMP VERDE THROUGH 315 PM MST... At 244 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms and strong outflow winds extending from near Sedona to Big Park to Montezuma. Storms were moving west at 15 mph with outflow moving west closer to 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. The thunderstorm outflow winds may occur ahead of any rain or hail! SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Camp Verde, Sedona, Mcguireville, Village At Oak Creek, Montezuma Castle National Monument, Page Springs, Stoneman Lake, Montezuma Well, Rimrock, Middle Verde, Lake Montezuma, Cornville, Wet Beaver Creek Campground, Red Rock State Park, V Bar V Visitors Center, and Clear Creek Campgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 285 and 318. State Route 260 between mile markers 216 and 250. State Route 179 between mile markers 299 and 313. State Route 89A between mile markers 361 and 376. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Northern Gila County
